qas.question: When did King Richard I begin his reign?
Which animal is the main motif of England's national football team?
What type of headgear originally appeared on the lions' heads on England's national football team motif?
In which year was the FA given an official coat of arms by the College of Arms?
Since 2003, England has topped their logo with a star to recognize their World Cup win in which year?
In what year was King Richard I born?
Where is the English logo currently embroidered on their shirts?
What colour are the ten Tudor roses on England's shirts?
In what year was the College of Arms established?
Who established the College of Arms?

context: The motif of the England national football team has three lions passant guardant, the emblem of King Richard I, who reigned from 1189 to 1199. The lions, often blue, have had minor changes to colour and appearance. Initially topped by a crown, this was removed in 1949 when the FA was given an official coat of arms by the College of Arms; this introduced ten Tudor roses, one for each of the regional branches of the FA. Since 2003, England top their logo with a star to recognise their World Cup win in 1966; this was first embroidered onto the left sleeve of the home kit, and a year later was moved to its current position, first on the away shirt.

qas.question: What color were England's first away kits?
What color are the socks traditionally worn in England's away kits?
Three times in 1996, England wore what color socks in their away kits instead of the traditional red socks?
In 2011, England introduced a new away kit in what color?
When a new edition of England's away kit has been introduced, the kit is sometimes worn during what type of matches?
In what year did England stop using blue away kits?
What did Germany's supporters think of their kits during the Euro 96 matches?
What shade of blue was used in England's first away kits?

plausible_answers.text: red shirts, white shorts and red socks

qas.question: What color kits was Germany wearing during the Euro 96?
What shade of red is England's traditional away colour shirts?

context: Although England's first away kits were blue, England's traditional away colours are red shirts, white shorts and red socks. In 1996, England's away kit was changed to grey shirts, shorts and socks. This kit was only worn three times, including against Germany in the semi-final of Euro 96 but the deviation from the traditional red was unpopular with supporters and the England away kit remained red until 2011, when a navy blue away kit was introduced. The away kit is also sometimes worn during home matches, when a new edition has been released to promote it.

qas.question: In what year was England most recently eliminated from FIFA World Cup contention?
In which three years did England fail to qualify for the World Cup?
In 2014, England was eliminated from the World Cup after being defeated by Italy and which other team?
After the first round of the 2014 FIFA World Cup, how many teams remained in contention?
What was the final score when, in 2010, England lost to Germany in the Round of 16 of the FIFA World Cup?
Where was the 1974 World Cup held?
What was one of the four teams that remained after the first round in 1950?
Where did Slovenia place in the 2010 World Cup games?
What was the score when England played Italy in the 2014 FIFA World Cup?
In what year was Germany's football team's worst defeat?

context: England failed to qualify for the World Cup in 1974, 1978 and 1994. The team's earliest exit in the competition itself was its elimination in the first round in 1950, 1958 and most recently in the 2014 FIFA World Cup, after being defeated in both their opening two matches for the first time, versus Italy and Uruguay in Group D. In 1950, four teams remained after the first round, in 1958 eight teams remained and in 2014 sixteen teams remained. In 2010, England suffered its most resounding World Cup defeat (4–1 to Germany) in the Round of 16, after drawing with the United States and Algeria and defeating Slovenia 1–0 in the group stage.

qas.question: In what year did England suffer their first defeat at home to a foreign team?
What was the final score of England's worst ever defeat?
In what year did England reach the quarter-finals of the FIFA World Cup for the first time?
To whom is the quote "it was like playing men from outer space" attributed?
After reaching the FIFA World Cup quarter-finals for the first time, to whom did England lose with a final score of 4-2?
In what year was Goodison Park built?
In what year did Syd Owen start playing for England's football team?
On what date in 1953 did England's football team lose to Hungary?
What was the score of England's football teams biggest win?

context: Their first ever defeat on home soil to a foreign team was an 0–2 loss to the Republic of Ireland, on 21 September 1949 at Goodison Park. A 6–3 loss in 1953 to Hungary, was their second defeat by a foreign team at Wembley. In the return match in Budapest, Hungary won 7–1. This still stands as England's worst ever defeat. After the game, a bewildered Syd Owen said, "it was like playing men from outer space". In the 1954 FIFA World Cup, England reached the quarter-finals for the first time, and lost 4–2 to reigning champions Uruguay.

qas.question: In what year did Capello resign as England's football manager?
Capello resigned as England's football manager after a dispute over removing which player from team captaincy?
Who became the new manager of England's football team in May of 2012?
In which round of UEFA Euro 2012 was England eliminated?
A defeat by which team ultimately eliminated England from UEFA Euro 2012?
In what year was Capello made England's manager?
what country hosted the UEFA Euro 2012?
Who was the manager of Italy's team in 2012?
In what year did John Terry become captain of England's team?
Who won the UEFA Euro 2012?

context: In February 2012, Capello resigned from his role as England manager, following a disagreement with the FA over their request to remove John Terry from team captaincy after accusations of racial abuse concerning the player. Following this, there was media speculation that Harry Redknapp would take the job. However, on 1 May 2012, Roy Hodgson was announced as the new manager, just six weeks before UEFA Euro 2012. England managed to finish top of their group, winning two and drawing one of their fixtures, but exited the Championships in the quarter-finals via a penalty shoot-out, this time to Italy.

qas.question: Which governing body controls the England national football team?
Which other team, besides England, is one of the  two oldest national teams in football?
In what year did England and Scotland play the world's first international football match?
What is the name of England's home field in London?
Who is the current team manager of England's football team?
When was FIFA founded?
Where does the Isle of Man football team play home games?
Who is the Isle of Man football team manager?
Where is Roy Hodgson from?
In what year did Roy Hodgson become the team manager of England's football team?

context: The England national football team represents England and the Crown Dependencies of Jersey, Guernsey and the Isle of Man for football matches as part of FIFA-authorised events, and is controlled by The Football Association, the governing body for football in England. England are one of the two oldest national teams in football; alongside Scotland, whom they played in the world's first international football match in 1872. England's home ground is Wembley Stadium, London, and the current team manager is Roy Hodgson.

qas.question: In which year did England join FIFA?
England played against countries besides the Home Nations for the first time in what year?
In what year did Wembley Stadium open?
England left FIFA in 1928 and ultimately rejoined in what year?
What was the first year after England left and rejoined FIFA in which they played in a World Cup?
In what year did FIFA come into existence?
In what year was the first World Cup played?
What was the score the first time the United States competed for a World Cup?
What was the name of one of the home stadiums England played in prior to 1923?
In what year did the United States join FIFA?

context: To begin with, England had no permanent home stadium. They joined FIFA in 1906 and played their first ever games against countries other than the Home Nations on a tour of Central Europe in 1908. Wembley Stadium was opened in 1923 and became their home ground. The relationship between England and FIFA became strained, and this resulted in their departure from FIFA in 1928, before they rejoined in 1946. As a result, they did not compete in a World Cup until 1950, in which they were beaten in a 1–0 defeat by the United States, failing to get past the first round in one of the most embarrassing defeats in the team's history.

qas.question: In which place did England finish in the UEFA European Football Championship in 1968?
In how many UEFA European Championship Finals has England competed?
Where does England rank in terms of the number of UEFA European Football Championship appearances?
In what four years was England eliminated from the UEFA European Championship in the first round?
In which five years did England fail to qualify for the UEFA European Championship?
Who hosted the UEFA European Football Championship in 1968?
Who finished in first place at the 1968 UEFA European Football Championship?
In what year was the first UEFA European Football Championship held?
In what year did England play its first UEFA European Football Championship match?
In what country was the 1980 UEFA European Football Championship held?

context: England is quite a successful nation at the UEFA European Football Championship, having finished in third place in 1968 and reached the semi-final in 1996. England hosted Euro 96 and have appeared in eight UEFA European Championship Finals tournaments, tied for ninth-best. The team has also reached the quarter-final on two recent occasions in 2004 and 2012. The team's worst result in the competition was a first-round elimination in 1980, 1988, 1992 and 2000. The team did not enter in 1960, and they failed to qualify in 1964, 1972, 1976, 1984, and 2008.

qas.question: A defeat by which team eliminated England from the 1970 FIFA World Cup?
What was the final score of England's last match of the 1970 FIFA World Cup?
In which year did England fail to qualify for the FIFA World Cup resulting in Ramsey's dismissal?
Where did the 1970 FIFA World Cup take place?
Where did the 1982 FIFA World Cup take place?
In what year was Ron Greenwood born?
In what country was the World Cup played in 1974?
Where was the World Cup played in 1974?
What was one of the teams England's football team played in the 1982 World Cup games?
In what year did Ron Greenwood take over leadership of England's football team?

context: England qualified for the 1970 FIFA World Cup in Mexico as reigning champions, and reached the quarter-finals, where they were knocked out by West Germany. England had been 2–0 up, but were eventually beaten 3–2 after extra time. They failed in qualification for the 1974, leading to Ramsey's dismissal, and 1978 FIFA World Cups. Under Ron Greenwood, they managed to qualify for the 1982 FIFA World Cup in Spain (the first time competitively since 1962); despite not losing a game, they were eliminated in the second group stage.

qas.question: Who was the first non-English person to manage England's football team?
How many competitive matches were lost under the tenure of manager Sven-Göran Eriksson?
What was the highest world ranking achieved by England under management by Sven-Göran Eriksson?
In what year was the contract of Sven-Göran Eriksson terminated?
In what year did Sven-Göran Eriksson become the manager of England's football team?
Who was the first English manager of England's football team?
What was the world ranking of England's team prior to Sven-Goran Eriksson taking over?
Who won the 2006 FIFA World Cup?
In what country was the 2006 FIFA World Cup played?
In what year was the Football Association established?

context: Sven-Göran Eriksson took charge of the team between 2001 and 2006, and was the first non–English manager of England. Despite controversial press coverage of his personal life, Eriksson was consistently popular with the majority of fans.[citation needed] He guided England to the quarter-finals of the 2002 FIFA World Cup, UEFA Euro 2004, and the 2006 FIFA World Cup. He lost only five competitive matches during his tenure, and England rose to an No.4 world ranking under his guidance. His contract was extended by the Football Association by two years, to include UEFA Euro 2008. However, it was terminated by them at the 2006 FIFA World Cup's conclusion.

qas.question: Commentated broadcasts of all England matches air on what network?
What was the first season in which England's qualifiers and friendlies were broadcast on ITV?
What network is ITV's affiliate in northern and central Scotland?
In what year was an England football match aired only via the internet for the first time?
Approximately how many total viewers watched the England World Cup qualifier on the internet on 10 October 2009?
In what year did BBC Radio 5 Live start broadcasting England's matches?
Who won the 2010 World Cup?
How many people listen to BBC Radio 5 Live broadcasts of England's matches during the 2008-09 season?
In what year was Setanta Sports founded?
Who did England play against on 10 October 2009?

context: All England matches are broadcast with full commentary on BBC Radio 5 Live. From the 2008–09 season until the 2017–18 season, England's home and away qualifiers, and friendlies both home and away are broadcast live on ITV (often with the exception of STV, the ITV affiliate in central and northern Scotland). England's away qualifiers for the 2010 World Cup were shown on Setanta Sports until that company's collapse. As a result of Setanta Sports's demise, England's World Cup qualifier in Ukraine on 10 October 2009 was shown in the United Kingdom on a pay-per-view basis via the internet only. This one-off event was the first time an England game had been screened in such a way. The number of subscribers, paying between £4.99 and £11.99 each, was estimated at between 250,000 and 300,000 and the total number of viewers at around 500,000.

qas.question: In how many FIFA world cups has England appeared?
Besides France, which other team is tied with England for number of appearances in the FIFA World Cup?
In which year did England win the FIFA World Cup for the first and only time?
In what place did England finish in the 1990 FIFA World Cup?
Which country hosted the 1990 FIFA World Cup?
How many FIFA World Cups has France been in?
In what year was Spain's first World Cup appearance?
Who won the 1990 World Cup?
Where was the 2002 World Cup held?
Where was the 1950 FIFA World Cup held?

context: England first appeared at the 1950 FIFA World Cup and have appeared in 14 FIFA World Cups, they are tied for sixth-best in terms of number of wins alongside France and Spain. The national team is one of eight national teams to have won at least one FIFA World Cup title. The England team won their first and only World Cup title in 1966. The tournament was played on home soil and England defeated Germany 4–2 in the final. In 1990, England finished in fourth place, losing 2–1 to host nation Italy in the third place play-off after losing on penalties to champions Germany in the semi-final. The team has also reached the quarter-final on two recent occasions in 2002 and 2006. Previously, they reached this stage in 1954, 1962, 1970 and 1986.
